body:
@hkarthik thanks for taking a look

However not every rails prod env uses a farm of servers or implements multiple log aggregation from a farm of servers :)

Looking at this objectively from any env or machine, just think of rake tail as another helpful task that you can ignore or use just like rake log:clear and other bundled rake tasks. 

Also I'm curious, what would your alias look like that would dynamically tail the current rails env no matter what machine or rails project folder you're in and how you would deploy it?  Also, see my comment above about log:clear... same arg could be made for it being an alias.

et al. -> before you mention this should be an alias, please provide the source for how you would make it dynamic no matter what machine or rails env (machine can have multiple env too) && how you would deploy it that's clean and simple && can be typed the same way every single time like rake tail.
